repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
As mentioned in #27469, there is an inconsistency between extmarks/highlights regarding the `end_col` option. Now the `end_col` option in the `nvim_buf_set_extmark` function can be set to `-1` - meaning to the end of the line.

Closes #27469.

comment_data.body:
why not validate it still?

    VALIDATE_RANGE((val >= -1 && val <= MAXCOL), "end_col", {
check for -1 explicitly, no need to allow other random values
what is this supposed to be testing? is `marks[2]` empty or something?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -173,6 +173,18 @@ describe('API/extmarks', function()
     })
   end)
 
+  it('end_col is -1', function()
+    set_extmark(ns, marks[1], 0, 0, {
+      end_col = -1,
+      end_row = 0,
+      strict = false,
+    })
+    eq(
+      "Invalid 'end_col': out of range",
+      pcall_err(set_extmark, ns, marks[2], 0, 0, { end_col = -1 })

comment_data.body:
From `nvim_buf_set_extmark` docs:
```
- strict: boolean that indicates extmark should not be placed
  if the line or column value is past the end of the
  buffer or end of the line respectively. Defaults to true.
```
So I think the purpose of the test you're referring to is to test what happens when `strict = true`.

I guess the better way of doing this is explicitly setting `strict` to `true`, but I tried to keep it consistent with other tests.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -173,6 +173,18 @@ describe('API/extmarks', function()
     })
   end)
 
+  it('end_col is -1', function()
+    set_extmark(ns, marks[1], 0, 0, {
+      end_col = -1,
+      end_row = 0,
+      strict = false,
+    })
+    eq(
+      "Invalid 'end_col': out of range",
+      pcall_err(set_extmark, ns, marks[2], 0, 0, { end_col = -1 })

comment_data.body:
> I guess the better way of doing this is explicitly setting `strict` to `true`, but I tried to keep it consistent with other tests.

That would definitely clarify the test. Other tests can be updated if you want.

I'll make sure to add it right away. Also, should I open a separate PR to clarify other tests?

title: feat(extmark): option to specify -1 for end_col in nvim_buf_set_extmark
